title: Canada's Trudeau Defends Use of Emergency Powers Against Protesters
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said at a judicial inquiry that local police lost control of the weekslong protests against Covid mandates.

title: EU Talks on Russian Oil Price Cap Stall but Deal Still Seen Likely
description: EU governments disagree over the level to set the price cap at and some of the other details of the G-7 mechanism intended to crimp Russian oil revenues.

title: Israeli Far-Right Leader to Take Important Security Role in Government
description: A coalition deal gives Itamar Ben-Gvir control of the police ministry and a seat in the security cabinet.

title: Fearing Sabotage, Europe Patrols Pipelines with Mine Hunters and Unmanned Subs
description: The destruction of Nord Stream pipelines in September alarmed security forces across EU. ‘The Ukraine war, and especially the Nord Stream explosions, were a wake-up call,’ said a commander at the Danish navy.

title: Flooding in Saudi Arabia Kills Two, Stirs Rare Public Anger
description: Municipal workers in Saudi Arabia’s second-largest city rushed to pump water and clear damage after flooding from torrential rains killed at least two people.

title: Iran Strengthens Military Presence on Iraq Border
description: The deployment is aimed at preventing the infiltration of Kurdish opposition groups based in Iraq and exacerbates the risk of a wider conflict in the area.

title: China's Central Bank Takes Action as Record Covid-19 Outbreak Hits Economy
description: The People’s Bank of China is cutting banks’ reserve requirement ratio in an effort to boost lending to households and businesses. Economists say the move will likely have limited impact.

title: China Sentences Pop Star Kris Wu to 13 Years in Prison for Rape
description: The court decision marks a rare victory for campaigners against sexual assault in China.

title: FTX's Collapse Takes Heavy Toll on an Island Nation
description: The Bahamas encouraged crypto companies such as FTX to set up shop. The firm’s collapse has left many islanders feeling frustrated.

title: Ukrainian Hospital Stymied Russians With Defiant Doctors, Fake Covid Outbreak
description: In a hospital in Russian-occupied Kherson, the staff’s resistance was part of an eight-month, mostly unarmed campaign by residents to keep the city Ukrainian—and out of Moscow’s full control—for as long as possible.

title: Russia Expands Shelling of Kherson, as Power Shortages Drag On in Kyiv
description: Russian forces stepped up their shelling of the southern Ukrainian city of Kherson, killing seven people and injuring at least 21 others, according to local officials.

title: China's Xinjiang Region Has Been Locked Down for Months, Casting Shadow Over Zero-Covid Easing
description: Local governments in the region have described the lockdowns as temporary and targeted, but accounts from residents and travelers suggest they have been widespread.

title: Cardinal Joseph Zen Convicted by Hong Kong Court in Crackdown on Dissent
description: The 90-year-old veteran democracy activist and five others were found guilty of failing to register a fund providing aid to antigovernment protesters.
